Release Notes:
--------
Fans of Belle and Sebastian&#039;s witty bookworm pop are an obsessive lot, and no
doubt they&#039;ll snap up this cherry-picked collection of BBC recordings from 1996
to 2001. The draw for devotees is four rare songs from a 2001 session, including
a hilarious fan letter to kindred indie-pop intellectuals the Go-Betweens
("Shoot the Sexual Athlete") and a kind of hushed farewell sung by Isobel
Campbell, who left the group soon after ("Nothing in the Silence"). Otherwise,
aside from a breezy glockenspiel revision of "Lazy Line Painter Jane," these
versions are pretty close to the studio originals. But the selection is so good,
the set doubles as a best-of ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ it&#039;s a fine intro to the group&#039;s tuneful world of
lovelorn geekdom.
